description: From Middle English liggen, from Old English licgan (“to lie, be situated, be at rest, remain”) and Old Norse liggja (“to lie”). More at lie.

entries.meaning: (UK, slang, obsolete) A lie; an untruth.
examples: And the Muse of Arts that never told a lig, / Whirls in her mid-air flight to sing of Twigg;  […]

verbs.description: lig (third-person singular simple present ligs, present participle ligging, simple past ligged or lag or lay, past participle ligged or laggen or lain)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, UK dialectal, obsolete) To lie; be in a prostrate or recumbent position.
